name: Aadhaar Deactivation Threat Scam
description: Scammer impersonates UIDAI claiming the victim's Aadhaar will be deactivated due to suspected misuse, then directs them to a phishing link and collects personal information.

turns.scammer_message: UIDAI ALERT: Your Aadhaar number linked to mobile +91-XXXXXXXX will be deactivated on 18/02/2026 due to suspected misuse. Verify immediately to prevent deactivation.
turns.notes: Initial scare message impersonating UIDAI with deactivation threat.

turns.scammer_message: Dear citizen, your Aadhaar has been flagged for misuse in a fraud case. To prevent permanent deactivation, complete re-verification at our official portal: http://aadhaar-verification-portal.in/verify — Upload your Aadhaar front/back and a selfie for biometric matching.
turns.notes: Scammer shares phishing link disguised as official UIDAI verification portal.

turns.scammer_message: If you are unable to access the portal, please call our UIDAI helpline at +91-7788991100 for assisted verification. Our officers are available 24x7. You can also email your Aadhaar copy to support@uidai-helpline.com for manual processing.
turns.notes: Scammer provides fake phone number and email address as alternative contact methods.

turns.scammer_message: We have received multiple complaints about your Aadhaar being used for fraudulent SIM cards and bank accounts. This is a serious offence under IT Act Section 66D. Complete verification at http://aadhaar-verification-portal.in/verify within 12 hours or face legal action.
turns.notes: Scammer escalates with legal threats and repeats phishing link.

turns.scammer_message: FINAL WARNING: Your Aadhaar deactivation is scheduled for today 11:59 PM. All linked services — bank accounts, SIM cards, PAN, passport — will be suspended. Call +91-7788991100 NOW or write to support@uidai-helpline.com to stop the process. This is your last chance.
turns.notes: Final urgency with deadline, repeating phone and email with threat of all linked services being suspended.
